Marlin and sharks spend most of the year cruising the depths of the Pacific,
and then during the summer they feed off the northeastern corner of New Zealand. promote game fishing.
His fishing techniques captured trophy fish and his books and films captured the imagination of the world's anglers. In 50 years, gamefishings developed into a thriving tourist industry,
with charter boats at the ports of Taronga, Fittiyanga, Fungaroa, Tutukaka, Pahia and Russell.
Each year, anglers come to the villages and towns along the coast to pit their skills against the nomads of the deep.
The saying goes, big baits big baits. The saying goes, big bait, big fish.

Some skip along the wave tops, others dive below.
As well as baits, some anglers troll lures which have the colours and variety of Christmas decorations.
For day after day, the fleet scours the ocean at a steady three to four knots.
